org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.layout
Class BoxLayoutData

java.lang.Object
  org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.layout.LayoutData
      org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.layout.BoxLayoutData

public final class BoxLayoutData
extends LayoutData

Layout data object for BoxLayout. Each widget controlled by a BoxLayout can have its initial width and height specified by an instance of this layout data object.

Author:
georgopoulos.georgios(at)gmail.com
See Also:
BoxLayout

Constructor Detail

BoxLayoutData

public BoxLayoutData()
Creates a new instance of BoxLayoutData. The associated widget should be undecorated. The width and height of the widget should be the calculated preferred width and height returned by BaseLayout.getFlowWidth(Widget) and BaseLayout.getFlowHeight(Widget).

BoxLayoutData

public BoxLayoutData(boolean decorate)
Creates a new instance of BoxLayoutData by specifying that the associated widget should be decorated if parameter decorate is true, and undecorated if false. The width and height of the widget should be the calculated preferred width and height returned by BaseLayout.getFlowWidth(Widget) and BaseLayout.getFlowHeight(Widget).

Parameters:
decorate - decorate specifies whether the associated widget will be decorated or not.

BoxLayoutData

public BoxLayoutData(double width,
                     double height)
Creates a new instance of BoxLayoutData. The associated widget should be undecorated. The width and height of the widget is specified by the width and height parameters. Values > 0 and <= 1 are in ratios of the available client area except paddings, 0 and values > 1 are in pixels, and -1 means the calculated preferred size.

Parameters:
width - the preferred width or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred width should be used instead of this value.
height - the preferred height or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred height should be used instead of this value.

BoxLayoutData

public BoxLayoutData(double width,
                     double height,
                     boolean decorate)
Creates a new instance of BoxLayoutData by specifying that the associated widget should be decorated if parameter decorate is true, and undecorated if false. The width and height of the widget is specified by the width and height parameters. Values > 0 and <= 1 are in ratios of the available client area except paddings, 0 and values > 1 are in pixels, and -1 means preferred size.

Parameters:
width - the preferred width or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred width should be used instead of this value.
height - the preferred height or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred height should be used instead of this value.
decorate - specifies whether the associated widget will be decorated or not.

BoxLayoutData

public BoxLayoutData(BoxLayoutData.FillStyle fillStyle)
Creates a new instance of BoxLayoutData. The associated widget should be undecorated. The width and height of the widget depends on the fillStyle parameter:
  • for BoxLayoutData.FillStyle.BOTH the child widget will be stretched to fill the available space in both directions
  • for BoxLayoutData.FillStyle.HORIZONTAL the child widget will be stretched only horizontally, while in the vertical direction the widget's height should be the calculated preferred height returned by BaseLayout.getFlowHeight(Widget)
  • for BoxLayoutData.FillStyle.VERTICAL the child widget will be stretched only vertically, while in the horizontal direction the widget's width should be the calculated preferred width returned by BaseLayout.getFlowWidth(Widget)

Parameters:
fillStyle - specifies whether the child widget will be stretched to fill the available space in both directions, or only horizontally or only vertically.

BoxLayoutData

public BoxLayoutData(BoxLayoutData.FillStyle fillStyle,
                     boolean decorate)
Creates a new instance of BoxLayoutData by specifying that the associated widget should be decorated if parameter decorate is true, and undecorated if false. The width and height of the widget depends on the fillStyle parameter:
  • for BoxLayoutData.FillStyle.BOTH the child widget will be stretched to fill the available space in both directions
  • for BoxLayoutData.FillStyle.HORIZONTAL the child widget will be stretched only horizontally, while in the vertical direction the widget's height should be the calculated preferred height returned by BaseLayout.getFlowHeight(Widget)
  • for BoxLayoutData.FillStyle.VERTICAL the child widget will be stretched only vertically, while in the horizontal direction the widget's width should be the calculated preferred width returned by BaseLayout.getFlowWidth(Widget)

Parameters:
fillStyle - specifies whether the child widget will be stretched to fill the available space in both directions, or only horizontally or only vertically.
decorate - decorate specifies whether the associated widget will be decorated or not.
Method Detail

getPreferredHeight

public double getPreferredHeight()
Returns the user specified preferred height in pixels or ratio of the available client area height except paddings. Default is -1 which means that the widget's calculated preferred height should be used instead. Values > 0 and <= 1 are ratios, 0 and values > 1 are pixels.

Returns:
the preferred height or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred height should be used instead of this value.
See Also:
BaseLayout.getFlowHeight(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget)

getPreferredWidth

public double getPreferredWidth()
Returns the user specified preferred width in pixels or ratio of the available client area width except paddings. Default is -1 which means that the widget's calculated preferred width should be used instead. Values > 0 and <= 1 are ratios, 0 and values > 1 are pixels.

Returns:
the preferred width or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred width should be used instead of this value.
See Also:
BaseLayout.getFlowWidth(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget)

isFillHeight

public boolean isFillHeight()
Returns true the child widget will be stretched vertically, false otherwise.

Returns:
true the child widget will be stretched vertically, false otherwise.

isFillWidth

public boolean isFillWidth()
Returns true the child widget will be stretched horizontally, false otherwise.

Returns:
true the child widget will be stretched horizontally, false otherwise.

setFillHeight

public void setFillHeight(boolean fillHeight)
Sets whether the child widget will be stretched vertically or not.

Parameters:
fillHeight - true if the child widget should be stretched vertically or false otherwise.

setFillWidth

public void setFillWidth(boolean fillWidth)
Sets whether the child widget will be stretched horizontally or not.

Parameters:
fillWidth - true if the child widget should be stretched horizontally or false otherwise.

setPreferredHeight

public void setPreferredHeight(double height)
Sets the child widget's preferred height in pixels or ratio of the available client area height except paddings. Values > 0 and <= 1 are ratios, 0 and values > 1 are pixels, and -1 means that the widget's calculated preferred height should be used.

Parameters:
height - the preferred height or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred height should be used instead of this value.

setPreferredWidth

public void setPreferredWidth(double width)
Sets the child widget's preferred width in pixels or ratio of the available client area width except paddings. Values > 0 and <= 1 are ratios, 0 and values > 1 are pixels, and -1 means that the widget's calculated preferred width should be used.

Parameters:
width - the preferred width or -1 indicating that the widget's calculated preferred width should be used instead of this value.
